title: AdditionalDichroic
description: This describes an additional dichroic  positioned in the light path for one or more channel available for this instrument.

subCategoriesOrder.ManufacturerSpec: This describes the manufacturer specifications for this component (i.e., manufacturer name, model designation and serial number).
subCategoriesOrder.Mirror: This describes a mirror positioned in the light path for one or more channel available for this instrument. An instrument may have several mirrors of different types, such as dichroic, beamsplitter or reflector.
subCategoriesOrder.Dichroic: A dichroic beamsplitter or dichroic mirror is a mirror that spectrally separate light by transmitting and reflecting light as a function of wavelength. In the context of fluorescence microscopy, they are typically used to reflect the excitation light, but transmit the emitted fluorescence. Dichroic mirrors can be categorized in different manners. However, the most important criteria for choosing a dichoric mirror are the transmittance and the reflectance wavelenght ranges.
subCategoriesOrder.AdditionalDichroic: This describes an additional dichroic  positioned in the light path for one or more channel available for this instrument.
subCategoriesOrder.TransmittanceRange: This records the range of wavelengths that are transmitted by the filter. It also records the maximum amount of light transmitted. Multiple of this elements can be used.
subCategoriesOrder.ReflectanceRange: This records the range of wavelengths that are reflected by the mirror.

DichroicType.description: The type of dichroic mirror used in this case.

HardSputtered.description: This field records whether this coating of this dichroic is hard-sputtered or traditional.

AttenuationCoefficient.description: The attenuation coeffieient of this dichroic The attenuation coefficient (aka blocking coefficient) is used as a measure of the out-of-band attenuation of an optical filter or dichroic mirror over an extended range of the spectrum. The attenuation coefficient is often defined in units of optical density (OD), wherease OD= -log10(T), and T=Transmittance (0≤T≤1).

AttenuationMethod.description: The mean by which this dichroic filter achieves out-of-band transmission attenuation.

Technology.description: The filtering technology utilized by this dichroic. The main types of filter technology used in fluorescence analysis are absorption (aka colored) glass, thin-film coating, and acousto-optical tunable, liquid-crystal tunable filters.

Polarization.description: This field records the polarization effect of this dichroic. Dichroic beamsplitters (and, in fact, any thin-film interference coating that is used at non-normal angles-of-incidence) will cause some amount of polarization. ), the precise effect varying greatly with wavelength and with the particular coating design.

FilterWheel.description: This can can refer to any arrangement of filters in a filter holder of any shape. It could, for example, be a filter slider.

TransmittanceProfileFile.description: This contains the location of a file in .csv or other suitable formats containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

ReflectanceProfileFile.description: This contains the location of a file in .csv or other suitable formats containing the wavelenght profile of this component.

Name.description: A user defined name for this component.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this component.

AngleOfIncidence.description: This field records the optimal angle of incidence (AOI) for this mirror. TheAOI is the angle between the optical axis of the incident light and the axis normal to the surface of the mirror. In specular reflection AOI is by definition equal to the Angle Of Reflection (AOR).

AngleOfIncidenceUnit.description: This field records the optimal angle of incidence (AOI) for this mirror. TheAOI is the angle between the optical axis of the incident light and the axis normal to the surface of the mirror. In specular reflection AOI is by definition equal to the Angle Of Reflection (AOR).

MirrorType.description: The general category this mirror belongs to.

Geometry.description: The geometrical shape of the surface(s) of this mirror.

RadiusOfCurvature.description: The radius of curvature of this mirror. A spherical lens or mirror surface has a center of curvature located either along or decentered from the system local optical axis. The vertex of the lens surface is located on the local optical axis. The distance from the vertex to the center of curvature is the radius of curvature of the surface.

SubstrateType.description: This field records the type of substrate that is used for the beamsplitter coating. It is typically a ground and polished piece of optical glass.

SubstrateMaterial.description: This records the chemical composition or the nonproprietary trade designation of the mirror's optical substrate. For dichoric mirrors the substrate is typically composed of a glass material with low autofluorescence, such as UV-grade fused silica.

GlassCode.description: If available provide the international glass code for the glass this polarization device is made of. This is based on U.S. military standard MIL-G-174, and is a six-digit number specifying the glass according to its refractive index nd at the Fraunhofer d- (or D3-) line, and its Abbe number Vd also taken at that line. The resulting glass code is the value of nd-1 rounded to three digits, followed by Vd rounded to three digits, with all decimal points ignored. For example, BK7 has nd = 1.5168 and Vd = 64.17, giving a six-digit glass code of 517642.

SerialNumber.description: The serial number of this component

LotNumber.description: The lot number of this component

SpecsFile.description: Provide the location of a PDF file with the specifications for the component as provided by the manufacturer.

Description.title: Description
Description.description: This is a simple multi-line comment or annotation describing this component.

TransmittanceRange.description: This records the range of wavelengths that are transmitted by the filter. It also records the maximum amount of light transmitted. Multiple of this elements can be used.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

Transmittance.description: The maximum amount of light this optical component is capable of transmitting at the peak wavelenght. It is represented as a fractional value from 0.0 to 1.0.

ReflectanceRange.description: This records the range of wavelengths that are reflected by the mirror.

CutIn.description: CutIn is the wavelength below which the response rate is below 50%.

CutOut.description: CutOut is the wavelength above which the response rate is below 50%.

Reflectance.description: The maximum amount of light this Mirror is capable of reflecting. It is represented as a fractional value from 0.0 to 1.0.

Tier.description: The tier level of this component.
